docs.snippet: Vitaly Mutko, the country’s minister of sport, tourism and youth policy, is preparing for what could prove a damning indictment of his administration....
docs.lead_paragraph: Vitaly Mutko, the country’s minister of sport, tourism and youth policy, is preparing for what could prove a damning indictment of his administration.
docs.abstract: Russian sports minister Vitaly Mutko awaits results of World Anti-Doping investigation into whether his ministry sponsored doping program for Russian athletes at 2014 Olympics; denies allegations made by former director of country's antidoping lab Dr Grigory Rodchenkov, which if true could lead to ban from 2016 Olympics.

headline.main: Russia’s Sports Minister Strives to Contain Damage
headline.print_headline: Russia’s Sports Minister Strives to Contain Damage

docs.snippet: Rather than appeal to the Supreme Court, Brady, the Patriots quarterback, said he would serve his four-game suspension at the beginning of this season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rather than appeal to the Supreme Court, Brady, the Patriots quarterback, said he would serve his four-game suspension at the beginning of this season.
docs.abstract: Ken Belson On Pro Football column applauds New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady for choosing to serve his four-game suspension for deflated football scandal rather than take case to Supreme Court.

headline.main: Deflategate Is Over: Tom Brady Ends Appeals Process
headline.print_headline: Show’s Over, Folks: Deflategate’s Run Comes to an End

docs.snippet: No matter what you think of his time in office, it’s hard to argue that the human being has been anything less than a model of class and dignity....
docs.lead_paragraph: No matter what you think of his time in office, it’s hard to argue that the human being has been anything less than a model of class and dignity.
docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column lauds Pres Obama for keeping his cool during numerous crises over his tenure and for maintaining his integrity as husband, father and man throughout; holds especially commendable are Obama's appeals for healing and open hearts in times of great hatred and chaos; contends many of Obama's efforts have failed, but he has not.

headline.main: With Obama, the Personal Is Presidential

docs.snippet: The sale of the U.F.C. for $4 billion last week may have hinged on March’s regulatory approval from New York, the last state to legalize the sport....
docs.lead_paragraph: The sale of the U.F.C. for $4 billion last week may have hinged on March’s regulatory approval from New York, the last state to legalize the sport.
docs.abstract: Ultimate Fighting Championship regulatory official Marc Ratner spent decade convincing state governments mixed martial arts was legitimate sport, crucial element in league's recent sale for $4 billion.

headline.main: Ultimate Fighting Championship Ends a Long Odyssey to Legalization
headline.print_headline: U.F.C.’s Payday Comes at the End of an Odyssey Through Statehouses

byline.original: By RICHARD SANDOMIR and KEN BELSON

docs.snippet: Several anti-doping agencies, including those of the United States and Canada, want a complete ban on Russia competing at the Rio Olympics if next week's key report into allegations of state-backed doping at the 2014 Sochi winter Olympics is damni...
docs.lead_paragraph: Several anti-doping agencies, including those of the United States and Canada, want a complete ban on Russia competing at the Rio Olympics if next week's key report into allegations of state-backed doping at the 2014 Sochi winter Olympics is damning, they said on Saturday.

headline.main: Exclusive: NADOs, Some Athletes Want Total Russia Ban if Doping Report Damning
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: NADOs, Some Athletes Want Total Russia Ban if Doping Report Damning

docs.snippet: The terror attack on a festive Bastille Day crowd in France indiscriminately killed locals and foreigners alike, men, women and children. The driver of a truck slammed into the festivities Thursday taking the lives of 84 people, including six from...
docs.lead_paragraph: The terror attack on a festive Bastille Day crowd in France indiscriminately killed locals and foreigners alike, men, women and children. The driver of a truck slammed into the festivities Thursday taking the lives of 84 people, including six from the same family. Among those who've been identified were Americans, Germans, Ukrainians, Swiss, Tunisians and a Russian.

headline.main: The Nice Victims: Losses Spanned 3 Generations, 7 Nations
headline.print_headline: The Nice Victims: Losses Spanned 3 Generations, 7 Nations

docs.snippet: Turkish authorities rounded up nearly 3,000 suspected military plotters on Saturday and ordered thousands of judges detained after thwarting a coup by rebels using tanks and attack helicopters to try to topple President Tayyip Erdogan....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish authorities rounded up nearly 3,000 suspected military plotters on Saturday and ordered thousands of judges detained after thwarting a coup by rebels using tanks and attack helicopters to try to topple President Tayyip Erdogan.

headline.main: Turkey Rounds Up Plot Suspects After Thwarting Coup Against Erdogan
headline.print_headline: Turkey Rounds Up Plot Suspects After Thwarting Coup Against Erdogan
